descript.abstract: FAOSTAT is an on-line and multilingual databases currently containing over 1 million time-series records covering international statistics including fishery statistics.
descript.purpose: FAOSTAT fisheries provides statistics on fish production and primary products.
descript.supplinf: Information was obtained from http://apps.fao.org/page/collections?subset=fisheries. (previous geoform was 'Database')

dataqual.complete: Fish production data are presented by 50 groups of species constituting the nine divisions of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP).

enttyp.enttypd: Provides statistics on fish production and primary products

attr.attrdef: FAOSTAT provides a list of country codes.

Fish production data are presented by 50 groups of species constituting the nine divisions of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP). Following a recommendation of the 19th Session of the Coordinating Working Party on Fishery Statistics - CWP (Nouméa, New Caledonia, 10-13 July 2001) the names and composition of former groups 33, 34 and 37 of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP) were revised. The species items of the former group 33 "Redfishes, basses, congers" were classified as coastal or demersal fishes and accordingly assigned to the new groups 33 "Miscellaneous coastal fishes" and 34 "Miscellaneous demersal fishes". The species formerly included in group 34 "Jacks, mullets, sauries" were moved to group 37, which was renamed "Miscellaneous pelagic fishes". For each ISSCAAP group, the table below indicates the corresponding codes in the FISH PRODUCTION and FISHERY DATA - Primary Products domains. Differences between the production data of primary products of the Fishery Data domain and those of the Fish Production domain are due to the different timing of updating of the source databases. In case of difference between the two sets of data, those in FISH PRODUCTION domain are the most up to date.

codesetd.codesetn: FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP)

attr.attrdef: Fish production data are presented by 50 groups of species constituting the nine divisions of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP). Following a recommendation of the 19th Session of the Coordinating Working Party on Fishery Statistics - CWP (Nouméa, New Caledonia, 10-13 July 2001) the names and composition of former groups 33, 34 and 37 of the FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP) were revised. The species items of the former group 33 "Redfishes, basses, congers" were classified as coastal or demersal fishes and accordingly assigned to the new groups 33 "Miscellaneous coastal fishes" and 34 "Miscellaneous demersal fishes". The species formerly included in group 34 "Jacks, mullets, sauries" were moved to group 37, which was renamed "Miscellaneous pelagic fishes". For each ISSCAAP group, the table below indicates the corresponding codes in the FISH PRODUCTION and FISHERY DATA - Primary Products domains. Differences between the production data of primary products of the Fishery Data domain and those of the Fish Production domain are due to the different timing of updating of the source databases. In case of difference between the two sets of data, those in FISH PRODUCTION domain are the most up to date.

codesetd.codesetn: FAO International Standard Statistical Classification of Aquatic Animals and Plants (ISSCAAP)

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Food and Agriculture Organization, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a Food and Agriculture Organization server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The Food and Agriculture Organization shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
